channel.title: Help when player dies
channel.description:
I have a problem when a player dies on my server. The player only drops mopar items. =\ do u know the problem if so are any code fixes i need to do?
plz post if there are any.

item.title: Help when player dies
item.dc:creator: @newbiehacker newbiehacker
item.description:
@newbiehacker wrote:

Evil_, does know what he’s on about, probably more than anybody that currently resides at moparisthebest.com.

Coding is relatively easy, but you seem to take the view that copy & pasting is easier; which of course it is, but then you don’t learn anything and so you end up being a leech your whole life and then you amount to nothing and end up as a road sweeper.

Please refrain from being a douschebag.

Read full topic

item.title: Help when player dies
item.dc:creator: @Evil1 Evil_
item.description:
@Evil1 wrote:

They told you the mother fucking answer.

READ WHAT THEY FUCKING POST!

Overview:

  1. Find what handles what happens when you die;
  2. Find out how it drops the items
  3. Add in the “Silab” items.

And this is honestly a perfect case on what Greeny means when he tells him to learn how to program, this kid doesn’t know what the fuck he’s doing and is just trying to have people spoon feed him the solution.

This is why moparscape is so fucked up that no one respectable wants to be here. Why can’t you all just grow the fuck up and start helping yourselves before trying to get someone else to do it for you.

Read full topic

item.title: Help when player dies
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

It’s hard to take someone called “omg ffs ownd” seriously.

Back on topic though you say; Your player drops are screwed. Fix it by reading the code. Learn by reading the code. Find out what stopped it from working, remove it, see if it works add it back in. Continue to debug until you find the cause of the error.

Read full topic

Keeps silab items, possibly?

item.title: Help when player dies
item.dc:creator: @Evil1 Evil_
item.description:
@Evil1 wrote:

[quote=“Waffles!!, post:10, topic:154709”]Evil_

If you had a compiling problem, and I said to learn to program, does THAT help you fix your error? I’d feel bad about myself.[/quote]Actually, yes.

http://java.sun.com/docs/books/tutorial/getStarted/cupojava/win32.html

See, if they’d actually fucking read those tutorials, they’d know a hell-of-a-lot more.

You can’t baby people their entire lives, if they want to program they need to do it like all of us did, without whining to every person with a Java Cup or Moparscape Vet title about their “code” not compiling.

Read full topic
